• PHPR Community Wiki

  • Github
  • Main site
  • Download
  • Documentation
    • User Guide - Handbook for users and administrators
      • PHPR Overview - Provides a breif summary of PHPR
      • Table of Contents - Contains a complete documentation listing.
      • Server Requirements - How to check system requirements.
      • Installation
        • Downloading PHPR - How to get a copy of PHPR.
        • Install Instructions - Describes the installation process.
        • Troubleshoot Install - Explains possible reasons of installation errors and describes how to fix them.
        • Automation set up - Some features require a crontab to be set up.
      • Basic Configuration
        • Global settings - change settings that impact the entire site
        • Website settings - modify site name and other front end settings
      • Content Management - using the Content Management System (CMS)
        • Managing Themes
      • Maintenance - this section describes common maintenance tasks
        • Performing a Software Update - describes how to update to the latest copy
    • Developer Guide
      • Design Patterns - Describes the best way to design your application.
      • PHP Style Guide - Best practice for PHPR development
      • Theme Tips & Best Practices - Collection of tips useful for developing on the front-end
      • Troubleshoot Development - Explains how to handle errors when developing.
      • Front-end
        • Templates, Pages & Partials
        • Content Blocks & Strings - Allows content management
        • Combine Javascript & CSS - shows how to combine and minify JavaScript and CSS files
        • Javascript Framework
      • Back-end
        • Adding Menu Items - describes how to add new menu items to the admin area
        • Lists - displays a list of a given model type
          • Creating List Popups - how to add popups to admin lists
      • Modules
        • Module Basics - Describes what a module is and it's importance
        • Creating a Module - Describes the process of developing a module in it's purest form
        • Access Points - register a module access point for calling module features them through public URLs
        • Using Events - Allow modules to extend other module functionality
      • Database
        • Database Basics - Describes methods used to access the database
        • Managing Table Structure - Describes how tables structures managed
        • Form Field Definitions - Determines how a column should be rendered in a form
        • Using Deferred Bindings - lets you temporarily store related database data
        • Creating a Data Feed - Combines a set of models in a feed response.
        • File & Image Storage - represents a link to the file system stored in the database
      • Sessions
        • Flash Messages - provides a way to pass temporary objects between actions
      • File System
        • Directory & File Management - commands to modify local files and directories
        • Image Manipulation - create thumbnails and modify images
        • Uploading Files - explains how files can be uploaded and stored
      • Common
        • Configuration - allows easy access to common config variables
        • Notifications - User and Admin Notification Engine
        • Trace Logging - allows the application to write the tracing messages to trace log files
      • Network
        • HTTP Requests - send a request through the network service
    • Class Reference - This sections contains details about PHPR classes.
      • Db
        • Db_ActiveRecord - Acts as a base class for models
        • Db_DataCollection - Represents a collection of database objects
        • Db_Helper - Used for interacting with the database absent of a model
      • Phpr
        • Phpr_DateTime - class used for date and time values
        • Phpr_Form - contains functions for working with HTML forms
      • Net
      • File
  • Module Documentation - Specific module documentation
